intro: Melancranis sylvatica, commonly known as the woodland melancranis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate forests of Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or pale green flowers during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and serrated, often with a slightly hairy texture. Melancranis sylvatica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland environments.
